intro: Scutellaria przewalskii, commonly known as the Przewalski's skullcap, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features opposite, lanceolate leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in whorls. It is characterized by its distinctive calyx that resembles a skullcap, giving it its common name. Scutellaria przewalskii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
